page.title: 14FENTON INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
page.content: The Fenton or"Berry-Hill"Industrial Estate was built on reclaimed land. There used to be a colliery,brickworks and pot-bank here.The pit called"Top Pits"was opened in 1863 and closed down in 1960. The reclamation took place between 1967-71. The ground now is very flat. When we walked around the estate we saw factories and warehouses.The factories are very modern,many of them are large and are of various types.For example there is an ice cream factory and a concrete works.There is a cash and carry warehouse and a large distribution depot for steel.There are a lot of new developments around and in the Industrial Estate and many parts have very nice landscaping.The environment is better than it used to be.The estate lies next to Victoria Road,the A50,an important transport route and a railway runs through it.
